comment.text: Amine transporter (PubMed:1406597, PubMed:8302271, PubMed:15505207). Terminates the action of dopamine by its high affinity sodium-dependent reuptake into presynaptic terminals (By similarity). Regulator of light-dependent retinal hyaloid vessel regression, downstream of OPN5 signaling (By similarity).

Homooligomer; disulfide-linked (Ref.14). Interacts with PRKCABP and TGFB1I1 (PubMed:11343649, PubMed:12177201). Interacts (via N-terminus) with SYNGR3 (via N-terminus) (By similarity). Interacts with SLC18A2 (By similarity). Interacts with TOR1A (ATP-bound); TOR1A regulates SLC6A3 subcellular location (PubMed:15505207). Interacts with alpha-synuclein/SNCA (PubMed:26442590).

disease.name: Parkinsonism-dystonia infantile
disease.description: A neurodegenerative disorder characterized by infantile onset of parkinsonism and dystonia. Other neurologic features include global developmental delay, bradykinesia and pyramidal tract signs.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
This protein is the target of psychomotor stimulants such as amphetamines or cocaine.
Belongs to the sodium:neurotransmitter symporter (SNF) (TC 2.A.22) family. SLC6A3 subfamily.

property.value: Dopamine clearance from the synaptic cleft
Expressed in substantia nigra and 72 other tissues
P:dopamine uptake involved in synaptic transmission
P:positive regulation of multicellular organism growth

feature.description: Contributes to high-affinity binding to cocaine
In a breast cancer sample; somatic mutation; dbSNP:rs760871529.
In PKDYS; loss of function; dbSNP:rs267607068.
In PKDYS; loss of function; dbSNP:rs267607069.
In a breast cancer sample; somatic mutation.
